reference.title: euare-assumerole
reference.shortdesc: Assume a role by using the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to get temporary security credentials for that role. Then configure those credentials so subsequent actions work using the role's permissions. The ARN always prepends to the left of the command to complete the string.

row.entry: ARN is the role you want to assume. If the complete ARN is not supplied, the command prepends this option. For example, when given 123456789012:role/S3Access, it prepends the arn:aws:iam:: to the entry.
The number of seconds for which the credentials it retrieves remain valid. Defaults to 900 or can be specified up to 3600.
Identifies the session and used to display your role's credentials. Can be randomly generated if not provided.
Generates C shell-compatible output. Default when the SHELL environment looks like C shell.
Generates Bourne shell-compatible output. Defaults to this option if the SHELL environment does not look like C shell.
Use this option along with pasting the contents of the IAM policy to further limit what the assumed role can do.
Use this option along with an actual IAM policy file to further limit what the assumed role can do as an alternative means to pasting the contents as exemplified by the above option.
A unique identifier that third parties can give to their customers to assume roles in their customers' accounts. For more information about external IDs, go to AWS External ID use case scenaior..
The identification number of the Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) device associated with the user who is assuming a role. If used, must be used in conjunction with --mfa-code.
The code provided by the MFA device that allows access to the role that a user is assuming. If used, must be used in conjunction with --mfa-serial.
